::: {#hero-heading}

Jian Ye (Senior Member, IEEE) received the B.Eng. degree in electrical engineering and automation from Wuhan University, Wuhan, China, in 2012, and the M.Sc. and Ph.D. degrees in electrical engineering from Nanyang Technological University, Singapore, in 2013 and 2018, respectively. He is currently a Technical Director and Professor of Engineering at China Southern Power Grid (CSG) in Guangzhou, China. His research interests include intelligent control for power electronics and microgrids.


## Background

- 2026 - Present：Technical Director, Professor of Engineering, China Southern Power Grid (CSG)
- 2019-2025: Assistant Professor/Associate Researcher, Harbin Institute of Technology, Shenzhen (HITSZ)
- 2018-2019：Research Fellow，Energy Research Institute @ NTU (ERI@N)
- 2014-2018: Ph.D. in Engineering, Nanyang Technological University, Singapore, specializing in Electrical Engineering
- 2012-2013: M.Sc. in Engineering, Nanyang Technological University, Singapore, specializing in Electrical Engineering
- 2008-2012: Bachelor of Engineering, Wuhan University, China, majoring in Electrical Engineering

:::
